alert.note: Alert for Brown; Johnson; Monroe; Morgan (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 8:30PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Monroe, southeastern Morgan, southwestern Johnson and Brown Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 830 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout along a line extending from near Bloomington to 7 miles west of Nashville to 16 miles northwest of Brownstown. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds in excess of 40 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Nashville around 850 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Martinsville. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
